repo.name: manifold
repo.description: Geometry library for topological robustness

readme.summary: Well-explained concept and use cases but critically missing installation instructions, quick start guide, and code examples for the Python package.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions or basic usage example for the manifold3d Python package - only links to external sandboxes

common_complaints: Browser compatibility issues (Safari rendering failures)
Edge cases in geometric operations (non-rigid transformations, negative volumes)
Performance and optimization concerns (simplification producing cracks, excessive copying)
Documentation gaps (solid coloring examples)
praise_themes: Proactive API design discussions (deprecation planning for Compose)
sentiment.summary: Manifold3D shows healthy community engagement with active maintainer participation, structured feature planning, and responsive issue management, though some geometric edge cases and cross-browser compatibility remain unresolved.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-11)

No merged PRs in past 6 months showing lack of active development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release history is unavailable or stale
positive_signals: Recent commit activity exists (2026-01-11), though appears to be isolated

repo.name: mistune
repo.description: A fast yet powerful Python Markdown parser with renderers and plugins.

cves.summary: Mistune vulnerable to catastrophic backtracking

In mistune through 2.0.2, support of inline markup is implemented by using regular expressions that can involve a high amount of backtracking on certain edge cases. This behavior is commonly named cat
Cross-site Scripting in Mistune
mistune Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability

Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the _keyify function in mistune.py in Mistune before 0.8.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML by leveraging failure to escape th
mistune.py in Mistune 0.7.4 allows XSS via an unexpected newline (such as in java\nscript:) or a crafted email address, related to the escape and autolink functions.

readme.summary: The documentation is clear and easy to follow for basic usage, but lacks comprehensive examples and configuration documentation.
readme.top_issue: Insufficient documentation of configuration options and advanced use cases.

injection_risks.description: The 'renderer' argument is not validated, which could lead to arbitrary class instantiation if an attacker can manipulate the input.
Regular expressions are used to parse user input, but they do not seem to be vulnerable to ReDoS attacks or other injection risks.

critical_findings: Potential arbitrary class instantiation vulnerability in the 'renderer' argument.
security.summary: The mistune package has some security concerns, including potential injection risks and input validation issues, but no critical secrets or error exposure vulnerabilities were found.

common_complaints: footnotes rendering issues
raw HTML content unescaping
sentiment.summary: The community health is neutral with some common complaints around footnotes and raw HTML handling, but the maintainers are actively addressing these issues.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally helpful and clear, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: Low number of merged PRs compared to open PRs
positive_signals: Moderate number of contributors in the past six months
maintenance.summary: The package is maintained with recent activity, but there are concerns about unresolved issues.

project_metrics.description: A fast yet powerful Python Markdown parser with renderers and plugins.

A vulnerability in the GraphCypherQAChain class of langchain-ai/langchain-community version 0.2.5 allows for SQL injection through prompt injection. This vulnerability can lead to unauthorized data ma
Denial of service in langchain-community

A Denial-of-Service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the `SitemapLoader` class of the `langchain-ai/langchain` repository, affecting all versions. The `parse_sitemap` method, responsible for parsing site
langchain vulnerable to path traversal

LangChain through 0.1.10 allows ../ directory traversal by an actor who is able to control the final part of the path parameter in a load_chain call. This bypasses the intended behavior of loading con
LangChain before 0.0.317 allows SSRF via document_loaders/recursive_url_loader.py because crawling can proceed from an external server to an internal server.
An issue in LanChain-ai Langchain v.0.0.245 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the evaluate function in the numexpr library.
An issue in langchain v.0.0.171 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the via the a json file to the load_prompt parameter.
An issue in LangChain v.0.0.231 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the prompt parameter.
An issue in Harrison Chase langchain v.0.0.194 and before allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the from_math_prompt and from_colored_object_prompt functions.
An issue in langchain langchain-ai v.0.0.232 and before allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via a crafted script to the PythonAstREPLTool._run component.

An issue in Harrison Chase langchain v.0.0.194 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the python exec calls in the PALChain, affected functions include from_math_prompt and from_colored_obje
An issue in langchain v.0.0.64 allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code via the PALChain parameter in the Python exec method.
SQL injection vulnerability in langchain v.0.0.64 allows a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information via the SQLDatabaseChain component.
An issue in langchain v.0.0.199 allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code via the PALChain in the python exec method.
Langchain 0.0.171 is vulnerable to Arbitrary code execution in load_prompt.
Langchain 0.0.171 is vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution.
In LangChain through 0.0.131, the LLMMathChain chain allows prompt injection attacks that can execute arbitrary code via the Python exec method.
